Title.evidence: Background: This study examines the impact of sarcopenia on postoperative delirium and perioperative outcomes in elderly surgical patients.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included studies on elderly patients (aged 60 and above) undergoing surgery, with sarcopenia diagnosed using validated criteria.

Objective.evidence: This study examines the impact of sarcopenia on postoperative delirium and perioperative outcomes in elderly surgical patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of postoperative delirium, with secondary outcomes including other complications and recovery metrics.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Sarcopenia was significantly associated with postoperative delirium (univariable: OR 1.81, 95% CI 1.31 to 2.50, P < 0.001; multivariable: OR 2.42, 95% CI 1.27 to 4.59, P = 0.007).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Systematic review registration: PROSPERO CRD42023424696 (18 May 2023).
